comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110523 Firefox/6.0a1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110523 Firefox/6.0a1

firefox hangs out when access https site and try to view info about security certificate

i click on site domain name(or button, don't know how to call it)near adress bar , and then when the certificate window  opens 
i click "More Information" button, that's where the "firefox death story" begins :) it hangs out, becomes unusable, and after a while windows tells that it isn't responding and suggests me to kill it :)

i tried to find such kind of bug in the list, but couldn't find nightly and in what section to search (there are too many firefox 5,6,7,8,,9 ??)
sorry if it already exists.


on firefox 4 32 bit everything works fine,

also i would like to add that 64b  nightly is more stable and fast than ff4 , and it is the first time when i notice something.... in it.
  

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1 go to gmail ,firefox bugzilla, other https sites, 
2 click on google.com near adress bar ...  
3 in the new opened window click "More Information"

Actual Results:  
firefox hangs, goes to sleep, becomes unusable, so i must kill it with :) task manager

Expected Results:  
everything to work fine like in ff 4.0.1

1 couldnt reproduce on ff4(32bit) on the same machine

2 i have Adblock plus 
       element hiding helper for adblock plus
       flagfox
 and   LessChrome HD 4   installed
comments.creator: necromantiarian@gmail.com

https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

comments.text:
with new profile everything is ok, works as expected



i share the same profile and settings between ff4 and nightly, and the default profile is from ~ ff 4 beta 8 till now
